🥗 Food Corner 🥘

Food is vital for sustenance, providing essential nutrients, energy, and nourishment for the body. Beyond physical health, it fosters cultural connections, social gatherings, and a source of joy and comfort in our lives.

  • Spaghetti Bolognese 🍝
  • Fried Rice 🍚
  • Hamburger 🍔

Ingredients 🛍️

  • 8 oz (225g) spaghetti
  • 1 small onion, finely chopped
  • 1 lb (450g) ground meat
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 can (14 oz) crushed tomatoes
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon dried basil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Grated Parmesan cheese (for serving)

Instructions 🧑🏼‍🍳

  • Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
  • In a large skillet, brown the ground meat over medium heat, breaking it up with a wooden spoon as it cooks. Drain excess fat.
  • Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until the onion is translucent.
  • Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  • Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese before serving.

Ingredients 🛍️

  • 2 cups cooked and cooled white rice
  • 2 eggs, beaten
  • 1 cup frozen mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn)
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions 🧑🏼‍🍳

  • Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
  • Add beaten eggs and scramble until they're cooked but still slightly runny.
  • Add the frozen mixed vegetables and stir-fry for a few minutes until they're heated through.
  • Add the cooked rice and stir-fry, breaking up any clumps, until the rice is heated.
  • Drizzle soy sauce over the rice, and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper.

Ingredients 🛍️

  • 1 lb (450g) ground meat
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 4 hamburger buns
  • Lettuce leaves
  • Sliced tomatoes
  • Sliced onions
  • Pickles
  • Ketchup and mustard (optional)
  • Cheese slices (optional)

Instructions 🧑🏼‍🍳

  • Divide the ground meat into 4 equal portions and shape them into burger patties. Season with salt and pepper.
  • Preheat a grill or stovetop pan over medium-high heat.
  • Grill the burger patties to your desired level of doneness, usually 4-5 minutes per side for medium.
  • While the patties are cooking, toast the hamburger buns on the grill or in a toaster.
  • Assemble your hamburger with lettuce, sliced tomatoes, onions, pickles, and any other condiments you prefer.
